metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5605 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Unspecified vulnerability in the Oracle VM VirtualBox component before5.1.4 in Oracle Virtualization allows remote attackers to affectconfidentiality and integrity via vectors related to VRDE.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5605` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

virtualbox - 5.1.6-dfsg-2
virtualbox-dkms - 5.1.6-dfsg-2
virtualbox-guest-dkms - 5.1.6-dfsg-2
virtualbox-guest-source - 5.1.6-dfsg-2
virtualbox-guest-utils - 5.1.6-dfsg-2
virtualbox-guest-x11 - 5.1.6-dfsg-2
virtualbox-qt - 5.1.6-dfsg-2
virtualbox-source - 5.1.6-dfsg-2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: virtualbox package in esm-apps/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.1.6-dfsg-2').
